latest_week.brief_summary: Relocatable OCaml framework merged with runtime search capabilities and domain backtrace inheritance
latest_week.new_features_summary: Relocatable OCaml with runtime IDs, domain backtrace inheritance, Unix socket improvements, new compiler flags
latest_week.new_features:
- **Relocatable OCaml** implementation by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) allows runtime and compilers to locate the Standard Library relative to binary installation locations via new `--with-relative-libdir` configure option, removing embedded absolute paths ([#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244))
- **Runtime IDs and filename mangling** system introduced for harmonious coexistence of different runtime configurations and versions on a single system, with mangled names for `ocamlrun` variants, DLL runtimes, and stub libraries ([#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245))
- **Runtime search capabilities** for bytecode executables via new `-runtime-search` flag (disable/fallback/enable modes) and `-launch-method` option (exe/sh/custom interpreter path) allowing flexible interpreter location ([#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245))
- **Domain backtrace inheritance** feature ensures spawned domains record backtraces when parent domain has enabled it, implemented by [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) ([#14416](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14416))
- **Unix socket address length handling** improvements by [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) enhance Haiku compatibility ([#14406](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14406))
- **New compiler flag** `-set-runtime-default` added to both `ocamlc` and `ocamlopt` for overriding default Standard Library location in executables ([#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244))
- **New compiler flag** `-dllib-suffixed` for recording mangled C shared library names with Runtime ID and host information ([#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245))
- **Enhanced ocamlobjinfo** now displays runtime invoked by bytecode executables through RNTM section analysis or shebang line parsing ([#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245))
- **CMT file stripping** now always removes typing environment with removal of `OCAML_BINANNOT_WITHENV` environment variable by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) ([#14373](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14373))
- **Breaking change** removing support for `let rec (module M : S) = e1 in e2` syntax by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) ([#14388](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14388))
- **AddressSanitizer on MSVC** progress with fixes for `CAMLno_asan` definition by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) ([#14414](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14414))
- **Pack prefix rewriting** fix replacing dots with appropriate separators resolving macOS issues ([d627617](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/d627617bc3c89bd0689e0820c4fe6d879c8b51ba))
- **Documentation improvements** including AsciiDoc file fixes, added markup and cross-references by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) ([#14392](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14392))
- **Build system enhancements** with new `--enable-runtime-search` and `--enable-runtime-search-target` configure options controlling bytecode binary runtime search behavior ([#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245))
- **Windows prefix handling** improvements on Cygwin/MSYS2 preserving backslashes in supplied `--prefix` for native Windows targets ([#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244))
latest_week.activity_summary: Active feature development with relocatable OCaml, atomic arrays, lazy evaluation, and type system work
latest_week.activity:
- **New PRs opened** this week include atomic arrays implementation by [@clef-men](https://github.com/clef-men) ([#14380](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14380)), concurrent blocking lazy evaluation by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) ([#14393](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14393)), named GC parameters by [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) ([#14367](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14367)), and Merlin typing recovery by [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) ([#14241](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14241))
- **Relocatable OCaml series** progressing with [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) merging core functionality ([#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244), [#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245)) while continuation PR targets opam integration with 19 comments of active discussion ([#14246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14246)) and source archive shrinking remains open ([#14152](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14152))
- **Type system work** delivered with removal of `let rec (module ...)` support ([#14388](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14388)), CMT environment stripping ([#14373](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14373)), and ongoing modular explicits work dating to July 2024 ([#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275))
- **Runtime and infrastructure** improvements through domain backtrace inheritance ([#14416](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14416)), Unix socket enhancements ([#14406](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14406)), MSVC AddressSanitizer progress ([#14414](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14414)), and Dune build system refinements ([#14408](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14408))
- **Documentation and testing** enhanced through AsciiDoc improvements ([#14392](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14392)), `__FUNCTION__` documentation with 18 comments ([#14412](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14412)), relaxed value restriction explanation ([#14407](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14407)), test refactoring ([#14409](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14409)), and pre-commit hook fixes ([#14050](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14050))
- **Long-standing initiatives** continue with Windows locale settings from 2021 ([#10258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/10258)) and always-keep-names proposal from July 2024 ([#13328](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13328))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Unix socket address calculation discussion regarding Haiku compatibility improvements
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **Unix socket address length calculation** discussed by [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) regarding improved handling and Haiku compatibility in PR [#14406](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14406) with related discussion thread ([#14401](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14401))
- **`__FUNCTION__` behavior** actively discussed with 18 comments on PR [#14412](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14412) regarding documentation of functionality for non-function contexts, prompted by issue [#14376](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14376)
- **Relocatable OCaml to opam** integration generating 19 comments on PR [#14246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14246) discussing deployment and distribution strategies
latest_week.trends_summary: Infrastructure modernization focus with relocatable installations, runtime flexibility, and platform compatibility
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Relocatable installation architecture** emerges as theme with comprehensive runtime search capabilities, relative library paths, and mangled runtime IDs enabling flexible deployment scenarios across platforms
- **Platform compatibility emphasis** visible through Windows improvements (MSVC AddressSanitizer [#14414](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14414), locale settings [#10258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/10258), prefix handling [#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244)), Haiku Unix socket support ([#14406](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14406)), and cross-platform bytecode launching mechanisms
- **Runtime system enhancements** addressing domain behavior (backtrace inheritance [#14416](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14416)), memory management (shared heap free lists [#13616](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13616)), and dynamic loading (runtime IDs [#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245))
- **Type system refinement** continuing with removal of experimental features (`let rec module` [#14388](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14388)), ongoing modular explicits work ([#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275)), and typing recovery for tooling ([#14241](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14241))
- **Developer tooling improvements** through enhanced debugging (domain backtraces [#14416](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14416)), better introspection (ocamlobjinfo runtime display [#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245)), and documentation clarity (AsciiDoc [#14392](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14392), `__FUNCTION__` [#14412](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14412))
- **Standard library evolution** discussions around new primitives (atomic arrays [#14380](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14380), concurrent lazy [#14393](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14393)) and API refinements (named GC parameters [#14367](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14367))
latest_week.contributors_summary: Active contributions from core team with Allsopp leading relocatable OCaml, plus runtime and tooling improvements

oldest_week.brief_summary: Five PRs merged including new Thread.set_current_thread_name API and compiler improvements
oldest_week.new_features_summary: New Thread.set_current_thread_name function for setting thread names on supported platforms
oldest_week.new_features:
- New **Thread.set_current_thread_name** function allows setting thread names from within thread functions, available on most systems that support the functionality ([#13504](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13504))
- **Documentation improvements** for `-safe-string` option clarification in Bytes module interface explaining immutability invariant protection ([1e5d73946f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1e5d73946f8f1074afeffbf155869ed9a0ff70ef))
- **GC verbose flag documentation** reformatted with cleaner hexadecimal notation (0x001 instead of 0x0001) in Gc.control interface ([1e5d73946f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1e5d73946f8f1074afeffbf155869ed9a0ff70ef))
- **String.to_seq documentation** enhanced to clarify behavior in "unsafe-string" mode where modifications during iteration are reflected in sequence ([1e5d73946f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1e5d73946f8f1074afeffbf155869ed9a0ff70ef))

- **Manual clarification** by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) disambiguating the `-with-runtime` option documentation ([#12912](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12912))

latest_week.brief_summary: API refactoring for legacy file format handling and UI improvement for dumb terminals
latest_week.new_features_summary: User input handling for dumb terminals and API changes for legacy file format separation
latest_week.new_features:
- Fixed **confirmation input handling** when `TERM=dumb` by reading full lines instead of single characters, resolving confusing behavior in terminals like Emacs M-x shell ([#6829](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6829))
- **API restructuring** split deprecated `url` and `descr` file implementations into separate legacy modules (`OpamFile.Descr_legacy` and `OpamFile.URL_legacy`) while creating simplified modern modules for current opam 2.6+ format ([#6827](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6827))
- **Legacy file format handling** now contained in dedicated submodules with `of_legacy` conversion functions added to support opam format upgrade mechanisms ([#6827](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6827))
- **Manual documentation** updated to clarify that as of opam 2.6, standalone `url` files only support legacy opam 1.2 fields, while opam 2.0+ should use the `url` section within the main opam file ([#6827](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6827))
latest_week.activity_summary: Solver optimization, test infrastructure improvements, and continued format upgrade work
latest_week.activity:
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) opened PR to **mitigate DNF explosion** in dependency formula processing when dealing with disjoint disjunctions, addressing performance issues with complex package constraints ([#6831](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6831))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) opened PR to **avoid downgrading root packages** when using the builtin-0install solver, improving package resolution behavior ([#6826](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6826))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) merged **GitHub Actions cache regeneration** fix that triggers cache rebuild when `OPAM_TEST_REPO_SHA` changes ([#6832](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6832))
- [@arvidj](https://github.com/arvidj) implemented and merged fix for **user input behavior** in dumb terminals, with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) providing refinements ([#6829](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6829))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) merged **API refactoring** that separates deprecated file format code from modern datatypes, creating foundation for future opam 3.0 format upgrades ([#6827](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6827))
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) continues work on **removing descr and url file handling** with draft PR queued on the merged API changes ([#6253](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6253))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Feature requests for constraint handling, MSys2 symlink behavior, and format upgrade mechanisms
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- [Simmo Saan](https://github.com/sim642) and [Brian Ward](https://github.com/WardBrian) discussed extending **`--ignore-constraints-on` functionality** to also ignore package `available` constraints for compatibility testing, with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) suggesting `opam pin edit` workaround ([#5283](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5283))
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) reported **MSys2 symlink behavior differences** from Cygwin in GitHub Actions workflow, with [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) confirming that MSys2 environment variable handling can be added to `OpamProcess` ([#6712](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6712))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) opened tracking issue for **opamfile format upgrade mechanism** cleanup, proposing to contain `descr` and `url` file reading within format upgrade code rather than always reading them even for opam 2.0+ files ([#6834](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6834))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) reported bug where **`opam pin add` doesn't upgrade** local git repository when package was already pinned to same location, requiring explicit `opam reinstall` to pick up changes ([#6833](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6833))
latest_week.trends_summary: Ongoing modernization of file format handling and solver performance optimization
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Legacy format cleanup** continues with systematic separation of deprecated opam 1.2 file format handling from modern opam 2.0+ implementations, preparing codebase for future opam 3.0 format changes ([#6827](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6827), [#6834](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6834), [#6253](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6253))
- **Solver optimization** work addressing performance bottlenecks in formula processing, particularly for complex dependency specifications with many disjunctions ([#6831](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6831), [#6826](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6826))
- **Terminal compatibility** improvements expanding support for different terminal environments, especially non-standard terminals used in development tools ([#6829](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6829), [#6828](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6828))
- **Platform portability** focus continues with attention to Windows environment quirks including MSys2 symlink behavior differences ([#6712](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6712))
latest_week.contributors_summary: Three core contributors active with API refactoring, UI fixes, and solver optimization work
latest_week.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) led **API modernization** by splitting legacy file format code into separate modules ([#6827](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6827)), improved **test infrastructure** with cache regeneration fixes ([#6832](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6832)), refined **terminal input handling** ([#6829](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6829)), opened **solver improvement** PR for avoiding root package downgrades ([#6826](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6826)), and reported **pin upgrade bug** ([#6833](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6833))
- [@arvidj](https://github.com/arvidj) implemented **dumb terminal fix** for user input confirmation behavior ([#6829](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6829)) and reported the original issue ([#6828](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6828))
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) contributed **solver optimization** PR addressing DNF explosion in dependency formula processing ([#6831](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6831))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) participated in **design discussions** and opened tracking issue for format upgrade mechanism improvements ([#6834](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6834)), provided guidance on MSys2 environment variable handling ([#6712](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6712))
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) maintains **draft PR** for removing deprecated file handling ([#6253](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6253))
- [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) reviewed and approved solver optimization changes ([#6826](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6826))
- [Simmo Saan](https://github.com/sim642) and [Brian Ward](https://github.com/WardBrian) participated in **feature request discussion** for extending constraint ignoring functionality ([#5283](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5283))
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) reported **MSys2 portability issue** with symlink behavior ([#6712](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6712))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Release of opam 2.3.0~beta1 with bug fixes, improved Windows support, and enhanced release infrastructure
oldest_week.new_features_summary: First beta release of opam 2.3.0 with bug fixes and platform improvements across Linux, Windows, macOS, FreeBSD and OpenBSD
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Release of opam 2.3.0~beta1** with comprehensive bug fixes and platform support improvements ([2.3.0-beta1](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/releases/tag/2.3.0-beta1))
- Fixed **VCS pinning regression** that stored untracked files in local VCS directories, resolving git submodule issues ([#6221](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6221))
- Fixed **platform compatibility** crash on OpenBSD where `getconf LONG_BIT` is unavailable ([#6230](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6230))
- Fixed **package cache corruption** storing wrong opam file versions after build failures ([#6213](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6213))
- Fixed **lint regression** W59 with local URLs that aren't archives ([#6219](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6219))
- **Enhanced Windows support** with fixes for OCaml 5.0+ compilation ([#6216](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6216))
- **Improved release infrastructure** including RISC-V Linux binary support and FreeBSD 14.1/OpenBSD 7.6 upgrades ([c7a1d9fc](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/c7a1d9fc0605f907ada31e165779995273dd5477), [7a78925110](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/7a78925110e0a6e005fc2c087d2fd0c7edf79a1a))
- **Updated install scripts** with 2.3.0~beta1 binary checksums for all supported platforms ([b600f1e88](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/b600f1e88f779db90fd2f57e911b749449e510f4))
- **New documentation CI job** added to GitHub Actions for automated doc generation and validation ([f48edffd](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/f48edffd118e8e50e8211a199c559c77162e1318))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Week focused on release preparation and infrastructure improvements with team coordination between Kate and R. Boujbel

latest_week.brief_summary: Signature help improvements and C code quality overhaul merged with comprehensive test coverage enhancements
latest_week.new_features_summary: Signature help refined to exclude function names and support unfinished let-in bindings; C frontend receives extensive portability fixes
latest_week.new_features:
- **Signature help** now correctly appears only on function parameters rather than function names, improving editor experience by reducing unnecessary popups ([#1997](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1997))
- **Signature help** extended to trigger on unfinished `let ... in` bindings, providing better assistance during incomplete code entry ([#2009](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2009))
- **C frontend** received comprehensive **portability improvements** including corrected Unix domain socket size computation for BSD systems using `offsetof`, proper Windows error handling with `GetLastError` and `FormatMessage`, aligned CMSG structures for file descriptor passing, and numerous compiler warning fixes across platforms ([#1998](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1998))
- **Build system** enhanced to use Dune for generating C compiler invocations, improving cross-platform compilation reliability ([#1998](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1998))
latest_week.activity_summary: Merged PRs focused on editor UX improvements and platform compatibility with extensive test suite additions
latest_week.activity:
- **Signature help** behavior refined by [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) to eliminate display on function names themselves ([#1997](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1997)) and enable triggering on unfinished `let ... in` bindings ([#2009](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2009)), reviewed and approved by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos)
- **C code quality** overhaul by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) addressing BSD socket handling, Windows API error reporting, CMSG alignment, and elimination of compiler warnings across platforms, with review and approval from [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) ([#1998](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1998))
- **Test coverage** expanded with reproduction cases for issues [#2000](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2000) added by [Tim ats](https://github.com/Tim-ats-d) ([#2003](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2003)), and comprehensive short-paths test suite covering abbreviations, records, functors, GADTs, opens, and polymorphic variants
- **CI compatibility** discussions ongoing regarding OCaml 5.4.0 support and `ppxlib` compatibility, with [PixieDust](https://github.com/PizieDust) and [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) coordinating on irmin dependencies and OCamlformat 0.28.2 release ([#2006](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2006))
latest_week.discussions_summary: CI failures with OCaml 5.4.0 addressed and Ubuntu 25.04 installation issue under investigation
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **CI failures** with OCaml 5.4.0 and `ppxlib` resolved through irmin 3.10.0 release after `ppx_repr` merge, with coordination between [PixieDust](https://github.com/PizieDust) and [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) on pending OCamlformat 0.28.2 release for full test suite success ([#2006](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2006))
- **Installation failure** on Ubuntu 25.04 with OCaml 4.13.1 due to compiler warnings treated as errors in `ocamlmerlin.c`, with [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) recommending migration to OCaml 4.14.X as the LTS version before OCaml 5, reported by [Grégoire Jadi](https://github.com/daimrod) ([#1993](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1993))
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on editor experience refinement and cross-platform compatibility with systematic test coverage improvements
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Platform robustness** emphasized through systematic C code review addressing Unix/Windows portability, BSD compatibility, and alignment issues that could affect stability on diverse platforms ([#1998](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1998))
- **Editor integration quality** refined with precise signature help behavior that reduces unnecessary UI popups and provides better assistance during incomplete code entry ([#1997](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1997), [#2009](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2009))
- **Test-driven issue tracking** with reproduction test cases added for multiple historical issues, creating regression protection and documentation of fixed behavior ([#2003](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2003), [#2005](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/2005), [#1996](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1996))
- **OCaml version support** discussions highlighting need for clearer LTS guidance, with focus shifting from OCaml 4.13 to 4.14 as recommended version before OCaml 5 transition ([#1993](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1993))

latest_week.contributors:

- [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) conducted comprehensive C code review addressing BSD socket handling, Windows error reporting, CMSG alignment, compiler warnings, and build system integration with Dune ([#1998](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1998))

latest_week.brief_summary: Major tracing infrastructure refactoring, new file visibility controls, DUNE_JOBS env var, and extensive performance optimizations
latest_week.new_features_summary: New (files) stanza, DUNE_JOBS environment variable, enhanced trace events, and workspace binary handling fixes
latest_week.new_features:
- New `(files)` stanza to control file visibility on a per-directory basis, similar to the existing `(dirs)` stanza ([#12879](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12879) by [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb))
- New `DUNE_JOBS` environment variable for controlling Dune concurrency, replacing the previous behavior where `INSIDE_DUNE` controlled concurrency ([#12800](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12800) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter))
- Trace events now include `argv`, process environment, and Dune version in config event ([#12909](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12909) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- Workspace root added to config trace event ([#12922](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12922) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- New promotion trace event replacing verbose log message ([#12949](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12949) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- New target resolution trace event replacing equivalent log message ([#12955](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12955) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- `--trace-extended` flag removed as its functionality is now always enabled when tracing is active ([#12908](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12908) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- Fixed workspace binaries not being accounted for when generating rules for `./.bin` ([#12952](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12952) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) fixing [#6220](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/6220))
- Fixed duplicate dependencies warning ([#12861](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12861) by [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal) fixing [#2678](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/2678))
- Fixed FreeBSD build by tweaking lmdb stubs ([#12926](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12926) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter))
- Fixed RPC not transferring promotion warnings to client ([#12604](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12604) by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) fixing [#12578](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12578))
- OxCaml parameterised inline tests support ([#12707](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12707) by [Lukasz Stafiniak](https://github.com/lukstafi))
- Solution logging improvements for package management autolocking ([#12871](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12871) by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV), [#12898](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12898))
- Tutorial updated to use autolocking ([#12859](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12859) by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV))
- New tutorial for setting up OxCaml projects with dune pkg ([#12780](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12780) by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV))
latest_week.activity_summary: Extensive tracing modernization, performance optimizations across core data structures, package management improvements, and platform compatibility fixes
latest_week.activity:
- **Newly opened PRs** include support for multiple stanzas in `dune-file` rules and `dune.inc` generation without dependency edges by [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) ([#12964](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12964)), directory loading debug event by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#12959](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12959)), hidden deps flags testing via trace by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) ([#12965](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12965)), and several others
- **Tracing and logging infrastructure** underwent extensive refactoring with trace events moving to `dune_trace` module ([#12867](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12867) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg)), persistent DB and process events restructured ([#12938](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12938), [#12940](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12940), [#12942](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12942), [#12943](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12943), [#12932](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12932), [#12930](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12930)), and `Stdune.Log` module introduced ([#12912](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12912))
- **Performance optimizations** delivered through `Lib.compare` optimization ([#12928](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12928)), appendable list compactness maintenance ([#12936](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12936), [#12934](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12934)), library hashing using IDs ([#12889](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12889)), ocaml-index memoization ([#12894](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12894), [#12918](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12918)), and parsing hot path string equality optimizations ([#12874](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12874), [#12876](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12876), [#12881](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12881))
- **Package management improvements** with toolchains using `DUNE_CACHE_ROOT` instead of `XDG_CACHE_HOME` ([#12858](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12858) by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS)), Pkg_rules.DB values not being recreated ([#12872](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12872) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), solver environment memoization ([#12918](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12918)), and opam template copy rules fixed for fs-io and top-closure ([#12954](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12954) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) fixing [#12947](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12947))
- **Build infrastructure updates** including OCaml version bump from 5.3 to 5.4 ([#12885](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12885), [#12951](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12951) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro)), ocamlformat bump to 0.28.1 ([#12937](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12937) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter)), Nix flake-utils dependency removed ([#12945](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12945) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro)), and copyfile stubs fixed for Alpine Linux ([#12901](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12901) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) fixing [#12896](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12896))
- **Cram test improvements** with lexing fix for single space comments after output ([#12903](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12903) by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) fixing [#12899](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12899))
- **Module compilation** split into separate flags and pp flags for increased sharing ([#12950](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12950) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg))
- **Code cleanups** including json library removal ([#12906](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12906)), `Dune_log` removing `This` ([#12910](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12910)), `Dune_util` stop re-exporting unix ([#12911](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12911)), and chrome_trace hiding from public API ([#12890](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12890))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Platform-specific build issues, dev tools reliability concerns, and package management feature requests dominated discussions
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- Alpine Linux copyfile stubs failure discussion highlighted platform-specific build issues requiring kernel header workarounds ([#12896](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12896) with 5 comments)
- Dev tools installation environment breakage risk discussed, noting that failed tool installs can corrupt user environments on BSD systems ([#12818](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12818) with 5 comments)
- Package installation with test dependencies (`fs-io` and `top-closure`) failing with `with-tests` flag was identified as a regression since 3.20 release ([#12947](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12947) with 4 comments)
- General tool installation support feature request advocates for removing hard-coded dev tools requirement, proposing that only special-case tools like utop and ocamllsp need custom handling ([#12913](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12913) with 4 comments by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder))
- Selective package lock upgrading discussed as users need ability to update specific packages without resolving entire lock ([#12820](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12820) with 4 comments by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder))
latest_week.trends_summary: Clear focus on tracing infrastructure modernization, systematic performance optimization campaign, package management maturation, and platform support improvements
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Tracing infrastructure modernization** is a clear focus with extensive refactoring moving away from ad-hoc logging to structured trace events, including removing `--trace-extended` flag, consolidating events in `dune_trace` module, and adding rich context like process environment and workspace root to trace data
- **Performance optimization campaign** targeting core data structures and hot paths with improvements to library comparison, appendable lists, parsing, and index memoization showing coordinated effort to reduce overhead
- **Package management maturation** continues with autolocking documentation, solution logging improvements, toolchains cache location standardization, and bug fixes for platform-specific issues
- **Platform support improvements** addressing FreeBSD build failures, Alpine Linux compatibility, and OCaml 5.4 readiness demonstrating commitment to broad platform support
latest_week.contributors_summary: Active contributions from core team with Rudi Grinberg leading tracing work, Ali Caglayan on platform fixes, and Antonio Monteiro on build infrastructure
latest_week.contributors:
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) led the tracing infrastructure refactoring with numerous PRs for trace events ([#12867](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12867), [#12922](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12922), [#12949](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12949), [#12955](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12955)), performance optimizations ([#12928](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12928), [#12874](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12874), [#12876](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12876), [#12950](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12950)), and code cleanups ([#12906](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12906), [#12910](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12910), [#12911](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12911))
- [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) contributed platform fixes including FreeBSD build ([#12926](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12926)), Alpine Linux copyfile stubs ([#12901](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12901)), cram test lexing ([#12903](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12903)), ocamlformat bump ([#12937](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12937)), opam template fixes ([#12954](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12954)), package management improvements ([#12872](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12872)), and concurrency control ([#12800](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12800))
- [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) handled build infrastructure with OCaml 5.4 upgrade ([#12885](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12885), [#12951](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12951)), Nix improvements ([#12945](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12945)), workspace binaries fix ([#12952](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12952)), and benchmark updates ([#12953](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12953))
- [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) implemented the new `(files)` stanza feature ([#12879](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12879))
- [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) improved package management documentation with autolocking tutorial update ([#12859](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12859)), solution logging ([#12871](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12871), [#12898](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12898)), and OxCaml project setup guide ([#12780](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12780))
- [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) contributed toolchains cache improvements ([#12858](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12858)) and RPC promotion warning fix ([#12604](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12604))
- [Sachin Beniwal](https://github.com/benodiwal) fixed duplicate dependencies warning ([#12861](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12861))
- [Lukasz Stafiniak](https://github.com/lukstafi) added OxCaml parameterised inline tests support ([#12707](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12707))
- [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) opened feature requests and engaged in discussions about general tool installation support ([#12913](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12913)) and selective package lock upgrading ([#12820](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12820))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Package management improvements, formatting enhancements, and bug fixes for `dune exec` crash and dependency resolution
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Dune file formatting now fills lines for version 3.17+, lazy dependency closure for package management performance
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Dune file formatting** improved to fill long lists on lines instead of vertical layout for lang version 3.17 and later ([10892a9](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/af95981164956dcafb4f4cd72358b5d0a4ad92ee))
- **Lazy dependency closure** computation in package management for better performance and memory usage ([#11025](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11025))
- **Package management** now allows OCaml syntax in dune files with lock directories, fixing dependency cycles ([#11026](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11026))
- **Standard aliases refactoring** moved to dedicated rules module for better organization ([#11030](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11030))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Multiple package management improvements, bug fixes for watch mode crashes, and build system refactoring
oldest_week.activity:
- **Package management enhancements** included lazy dependency closure computation ([#11025](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11025)), explicit build targets in tests ([#11024](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11024)), and OCaml syntax support in dune files ([#11026](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11026))
- **Bug fixes** resolved `dune exec -w` crash with package management ([#10960](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/10960)) and dependency filtering with version constraints ([#11021](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11021))
- **Code improvements** added memo stacktraces for better debugging ([#11023](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11023)) and moved standard aliases to dedicated rules ([#11030](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11030))
- **Test coverage** expanded with new test case for issue [#10927](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/10927) ([#11027](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11027)) and dependency filtering scenarios ([#11021](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11021))
oldest_week.discussions_summary: Issue reports for PKG_CONFIG_PATH handling on macOS and Coq extraction errors, plus enhancement requests
oldest_week.notable_discussions:

latest_week.brief_summary: Two RFCs merged: transparent ascription for module system and relocatable OCaml compiler
latest_week.new_features_summary: Transparent ascription with static aliases and relocatable OCaml compiler distribution
latest_week.new_features:
- **Transparent ascription and static aliases** proposal merged ([#54](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/54)) introducing transparent signatures `module X : (= P :> S)` to preserve module identities and type equalities, splitting module aliases into static (absent, used with `-no-alias-deps`) and dynamic (present) variants, enabling transparent ascription for functor parameters and applications, and adding new attributes (`@static_alias`, `@dynamic_alias`) for user control over aliasing behavior
- **Relocatable OCaml compiler distribution** proposal merged ([#53](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/53)) enabling compiler installations to be moved or copied to different filesystem locations without rebuilding, introducing `--with-relative-libdir` configure option to locate Standard Library relative to compiler binaries, adding `-runtime-search` option for bytecode executables to search for `ocamlrun` in multiple locations (current directory and PATH), implementing DLL name mangling scheme with host-triplet and runtime identifier suffixes to prevent version conflicts, and using `%standard_library_default` primitive with linker support to compute library locations at runtime
latest_week.activity_summary: Two RFCs merged after receiving stakeholder consensus
latest_week.activity:
- **Transparent ascription RFC** by [Clément Blaudeau](https://github.com/clementblaudeau) merged after receiving support from relevant stakeholders ([#54](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/54)), proposing redesign of module aliasing mechanism to split aliases into static and dynamic variants, introduce transparent signatures preserving module identities and type equalities, and enable transparent ascription of functor parameters and applications
- **Relocatable OCaml RFC** by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) merged after all implementation PRs completed ([#53](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/53)), enabling OCaml compiler distributions to be moved or copied without rebuilding through relative Standard Library paths, runtime search mechanisms, DLL name mangling, and debugging information mapping
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on module system improvements and compiler portability
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Module system evolution** continues with formal RFC process validating designs that enhance expressiveness while maintaining soundness, as seen with transparent ascription building on prior work around module aliases, applicative functors, and type-level sharing ([#54](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/54))
- **Compiler portability and distribution** improvements addressing practical deployment needs for opam switches and package management, enabling compiler installations to be moved or cloned without rebuilding ([#53](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/53))
- **RFC process maturing** with proposals receiving thorough review, implementation validation before acceptance, and clear stakeholder consensus requirements before merging
latest_week.contributors_summary: Two RFC authors and one reviewer active this week
latest_week.contributors:
- [Clément Blaudeau](https://github.com/clementblaudeau) authored RFC for transparent ascription and static aliases, proposing redesign of module aliasing mechanism with detailed technical specification covering signature language extensions, syntax additions, and interactions with functor system ([#54](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/54))
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) authored RFC for relocatable OCaml compiler, providing comprehensive proposal covering five areas where absolute paths are embedded (ld.conf, bytecode headers, standard library location, debugging info, build configuration) with implementation details and backwards compatibility considerations ([#53](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/53))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) reviewed and approved both RFCs for merging after confirming stakeholder consensus for transparent ascription proposal and implementation completion for relocatable OCaml proposal ([#54](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/54), [#53](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/53))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Multiple PRs merged fixing OCaml 5.x compatibility and autodetection issues
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Fixed compiler flag autodetection for OCaml 5.2 and improved thread handling
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Compiler flag autodetection** for `-opaque` and `-g` flags now works correctly with OCaml 5.2 by [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) - changed detection commands to use `-version` flag ([#80](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/80))
- **OCaml 5.x thread handling improvements** by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) - disabled various legacy thread handling parts for OCaml 5.x where threads.cmxa is now properly handled by META files ([#76](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/76))
- **OCaml 5.x compatibility function** added to detect when META files are available (`ocaml_has_meta_files` function in `findlib_config.mlp`)
- **Build system cleanup** by [Marek Kubica](https://github.com/Leonidas-from-XIV) - removed unused `.mml` references from Makefile ([#75](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/75))
- **Documentation improvements** by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) - fixed various typos across 14 files including documentation and interface files ([#62](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/62))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Planning phase for odoc 3.0 improvements with new issues for package infrastructure and driver enhancement PRs
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Added gitignore entries for odoc driver output directories to improve developer experience
oldest_week.new_features: - Enhanced **developer workflow** by adding gitignore entries for `_odoc` and `_html` directories generated by odoc driver ([#1218](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1218))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Three major PRs opened for index pages, sidebar overhaul, and frontmatter syntax plus active design discussions
oldest_week.activity:
- **Three new PRs opened** including index pages improvement by [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221)), sidebar and index overhaul by [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220)), and frontmatter syntax implementation ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210))
- **Index page improvements** delivered through driver-generated package pages with library and module listings, addressing need for better navigation when handmade index pages don't exist ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221))
- **Sidebar architecture** completely redesigned with unified tree representations across page, document, and unit sidebars, implementing smart content filtering that shows current page, ancestors, and siblings while avoiding overwhelming displays ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220))
- **Frontmatter syntax** development progressing with sexp-based approach for metadata like children order, short titles, and opens, though shifting toward existing `@-tags` syntax following [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli)'s recommendations ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210))
- **Planning phase** launched for odoc 3.0 infrastructure with [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) creating multiple issues covering opam metadata dependencies ([#1216](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1216)), markdown input support ([#1213](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1213)), deep sidebar JSON output ([#1214](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1214)), and driver compilation phases separation ([#1215](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1215))
oldest_week.discussions_summary: Detailed technical discussions on index page patterns, sexp syntax vs @-tags, and sidebar navigation design
oldest_week.notable_discussions:
- **Index page patterns** discussed by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) and [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) regarding automatically generated vs handmade pages, with emphasis on using section headings and `{!modules}` directives for better navigation ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221))
- **Syntax design debate** between sexp-based frontmatter and existing `@-tags` approach, with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) advocating for consistency with existing ocamldoc language rather than importing new serialization formats ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210))
- **Sidebar behavior** examined by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) focusing on predictability and efficient use of horizontal space, suggesting separation of global content from unit-specific indexes ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on improving user experience through better navigation, standardizing metadata syntax, and planning infrastructure upgrades
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Navigation enhancement** priority with multiple parallel efforts on index pages, sidebar redesign, and hierarchical content organization aimed at making large documentation sets more accessible
- **Syntax standardization** movement toward leveraging existing ocamldoc `@-tags` rather than introducing new formats, emphasizing consistency with established language conventions
- **Infrastructure preparation** for odoc 3.0 with comprehensive planning covering opam integration, driver architecture, and compilation workflow improvements

oldest_week.contributors_summary: Five contributors active with planning, PR submissions, and design discussions across navigation and syntax improvements
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) initiated comprehensive odoc 3.0 planning by opening four infrastructure issues covering opam metadata ([#1216](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1216)), markdown input ([#1213](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1213)), JSON output ([#1214](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1214)), and driver phases ([#1215](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1215))
- [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) contributed gitignore improvements ([#1218](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1218)), implemented index pages enhancement ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221)), developed frontmatter syntax ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210)), and identified sublist indentation issue ([#1219](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1219))
- [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) architected comprehensive sidebar overhaul unifying tree representations and implementing smart content filtering ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220))
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) provided detailed design feedback on index page patterns ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221)), advocated for `@-tags` syntax approach ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210)), and reviewed sidebar navigation design ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220))

latest_week.discussions_summary: Active discussions on package archival policies, maintenance intent defaults, and compiler support
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **Package archival policy** discussions including default value for x-maintenance-intent field ([#29060](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29060)) resolved in favor of `(latest)` with proposed implementation ([#29074](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29074)) by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm), immutability policy for opam-repository ([#29061](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29061)) proposing stricter rules ([#29072](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29072)), deprecation warnings support for archival-eligible packages ([#29071](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29071)) by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder), and draft archival process scheduled for January 1st 2026 merge ([#29058](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29058))
- **OCaml compiler support** discussion ([#29059](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29059)) by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) regarding supported compiler versions and maintenance policies
- **Package preservation** debate ([#28065](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28065)) requesting retention of old Dune versions by [Ralf Jung](https://github.com/RalfJung), ongoing discussion about archival policies
- **Windows installation issues** reported ([#29093](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29093)) by [@nopria](https://github.com/nopria) following ocaml.org installation instructions with multiple warnings on Windows 11 Home
- **Package loading failures** ([#29063](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29063)) by [@SunXT-0719](https://github.com/SunXT-0719) regarding compiler not loading third-party packages, resolved during the week
- **Source availability** issue ([#28966](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28966)) by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) concerning failed sources for alt-ergo 1.01 and cmdliner 2.0.0, still open
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on repository governance, Melange ecosystem growth, compiler automation, and Windows platform support
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Repository maintenance governance** initiatives gaining momentum with multiple policy proposals including stricter immutability rules ([#29072](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29072)), standardized maintenance-intent fields ([#29060](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29060), [#29074](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29074)), and scheduled archival processes ([#29058](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29058)), reflecting community focus on long-term sustainability
- **Melange ecosystem maturation** with coordinated releases across multiple packages (melange 6.0.1, melange-webapi 0.22.0, melange-testing-library 0.2.0, melange-jest 0.2.0) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro), demonstrating active JavaScript backend development
- **OCaml compiler package automation** with infrastructure improvements to retrieve metadata and sources directly from upstream [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) repository ([#29082](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29082), [#29080](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29080)), reducing manual maintenance burden
- **Windows platform improvements** with enhanced CI workflows, clearer documentation, and better cross-platform testing by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) and [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([#29036](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29036), [#29078](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29078), [#29086](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29086)), addressing Windows-specific build concerns
- **Parser and formal verification tooling** updates including elpi (2 releases), kot parser toolkit, Frama-C 32.0, and Codex semantics library, showing continued investment in language tooling infrastructure

oldest_week.brief_summary: Heavy week of package releases with 63 new packages added including major releases for YOCaml, opam 2.3.0 beta, and fixes for compiler installation issues
oldest_week.new_features_summary: New package releases for YOCaml static site generator, opam 2.3.0 beta, ActivityPub implementation, and Rust integration tools
oldest_week.new_features:
- **YOCaml static site generator** version 2.0.1 released with 12 comprehensive packages including markdown, YAML, Git integration, and multiple templating engines ([8965be0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/8965be0448d2eb507add00fc3c1b0c52ab4bcb60))
- **opam 2.3.0 beta1** released with 8 updated packages providing early access to new package manager features ([01638e0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/01638e0884c6a8cafdcd39d6e21c947902d08b81))
- **ActivityPub protocol implementation** suite released with 5 packages for decentralized social networking including client, server, and GUI components ([eeae27e](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/eeae27e7ee82ef2fed40c3e8c2024791991ef516))
- **Rust staticlib integration** tools released with multiple versions (0.1.0 and 0.2.0) for OCaml-Rust interoperability ([6f456bd](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/6f456bd754cfd8673752ba70897a2c33cceb278a))
- **HOL Light theorem prover** version 3.0.0 with fixed installation paths and source copying improvements ([86fa229](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/86fa2296e6c8132b1e29abac6a6f2e5d2cc075ef))
- **OpenAPI code generation** tools version 1.0.0 and 1.0.1 for OCaml with Opium web framework integration ([2dea405](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/2dea405ff1bb436553291fc47a3e52c0f42fd4d7))
- **CATT proof assistant** version 1.0 for working with higher-dimensional categories ([c877086](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/c877086b779f63da9d23134f867a19a24a895154))
- **Mirage unikernel** framework updated to version 4.8.1 with runtime improvements ([9aea193](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/9aea19340d871dbbc99952df8feb97ccab3f4d2f))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Repository maintenance focused on package submissions and bug report handling with 4 issues closed during the week
oldest_week.activity:
- **Package ecosystem expansion** with 63 new package files added spanning diverse domains from static site generation to theorem proving and web frameworks
- **Issue resolution** including [#26701](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26701) lablgl OCaml 5.2 compatibility closed by [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette), [#26749](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26749) gitlab.inria.fr availability issue resolved by [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers), and compiler installation problems [#26706](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26706) and [#26686](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26686) closed with community support guidance
- **Infrastructure resilience** demonstrated through quick resolution of external dependency issues affecting package installations
- **Compiler compatibility** discussions ongoing with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) addressing toplevel path configuration issues in [#25819](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/25819) and [Tahina Ramananandro (professional account)](https://github.com/tahina-pro) reporting Cygwin python3 configuration challenges in [#26434](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26434)
oldest_week.trends_summary: Strong focus on ecosystem expansion with web frameworks, static site generators, and cross-language integration tools
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Static site generation** gaining momentum with comprehensive YOCaml 2.0.1 release featuring modern tooling and multiple template engine support
- **Cross-language integration** advancing with new Rust staticlib generation tools enabling OCaml-Rust interoperability
- **Web framework development** progressing with OpenAPI code generation tools and ActivityPub protocol implementations
- **Package manager evolution** continuing with opam 2.3.0 beta1 introducing next-generation features
- **Theorem proving ecosystem** expanding with HOL Light 3.0.0 and CATT 1.0 releases
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Community contributors submitted numerous packages while maintainers handled issue resolution and provided user support
oldest_week.contributors:
- [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette) reported lablgl OCaml 5.2 compatibility issues and participated in package installation troubleshooting discussions ([#26701](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26701))
- [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) identified and reported critical gitlab.inria.fr infrastructure issues affecting package installations ([#26749](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26749))
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) continued advocacy for toplevel path configuration improvements with technical analysis of OCAML_TOPLEVEL_PATH vs OCAMLTOP_INCLUDE_PATH ([#25819](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/25819))

latest_week.brief_summary: Dependency management improvements with Binaryen documentation updates and issue discussions on compatibility and licensing
latest_week.new_features_summary: Updated Binaryen dependency documentation requiring version 119 or later for wasm_of_ocaml
latest_week.new_features:
- **Binaryen dependency** switched from `binaryen-bin` to `conf-binaryen` opam package, allowing use of distribution-provided Binaryen tools ([#2134](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2134))
- **Documentation updates** clarifying Binaryen version 119 or later requirement for `wasm_of_ocaml-compiler` in README and manual ([b329014](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/b329014705f1e347edaf01c0a9202d5a747e971c))
- **CI workflow cleanup** removing redundant Binaryen installation from GitHub Actions workflows ([b329014](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/b329014705f1e347edaf01c0a9202d5a747e971c))
latest_week.activity_summary: Merged Binaryen dependency improvements and ongoing discussions on stack overflow issues, WASI runtime, and API migration challenges
latest_week.activity:
- **Binaryen dependency management** improved by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) through merging [#2134](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2134), which switched to `conf-binaryen` package enabling use of distribution-provided Binaryen tools instead of building from source, addressing [#2131](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2131) by [@shym](https://github.com/shym)
- **WASI runtime** development continues with [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) discussing merge timeline for [#1831](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1831), while [#2108](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2108) remains open for JavaScript eval function access in Wasm runtime
- **Draft benchmark PR** [#2099](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2099) reviewed by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) questioning whether still needed, with 17K additions and 24K deletions affecting 326 files
- **Opam repository archival PR** [#2138](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2138) closed without merging after being opened by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo)
latest_week.discussions_summary: Active troubleshooting of stack overflow issues and discussions on number type migration challenges
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **Stack overflow bug** investigation in [#2122](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2122) by [Nikos Nikoleris](https://github.com/relokin) affecting Chrome and other browsers when parsing AArch64 code with Menhir-generated parsers, traced to commit 29c693b with [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) suggesting potential larger stack frames from new compilation scheme
- **Number type migration** guidance provided in [#2136](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2136) where [@tari3x](https://github.com/tari3x) seeks advice on updating code broken by [#1650](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1650), with [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) recommending manual conversion insertions or temporary patching of `js.mli` and `js.ml` files
- **License exception text** clarification requested in [#2137](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2137) by [Jessica Marz](https://github.com/jkmarz) identifying potential typo matching original OCaml project's error, with additional observation about version mismatch between documentation and actual LGPL license text
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on toolchain compatibility improvements and addressing compilation scheme side effects
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Distribution integration** improvements through conf-packages enabling better system integration and reducing build-from-source requirements, as evidenced by [#2134](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2134) and [#2131](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2131)
- **Compilation scheme side effects** surfacing as runtime issues, particularly stack overflow problems in [#2122](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2122) requiring investigation of stack frame size impacts from new compilation approaches
- **API evolution challenges** highlighted in [#2136](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2136) showing tension between WASM-driven improvements and maintenance burden for non-WASM users
latest_week.contributors_summary: Hugo Heuzard merged dependency improvements while Jérôme Vouillon provided technical guidance on multiple issues
latest_week.contributors:

oldest_week.brief_summary: Complete removal of wasm_of_ocaml backend (~32K lines), sourcemap improvements, and enhanced weak reference runtime
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Major architecture change removing wasm backend, improved sourcemap index support, and modernized runtime features
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Complete removal of wasm_of_ocaml backend** (~32,000 lines of WASM-related code deleted), transforming the project back to pure JavaScript compilation ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Enhanced sourcemap support** with index mapping for linking multiple JS files together, improving debugging capabilities ([1e54c94](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1e54c943918016553ed2ba6cf75abe29596b8833), [a0a03bd](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/a0a03bd67ecdf83a86350b9e5b391ceb39c9cf72), [6f38333](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/6f38333b2e704a615afd7dca0aab101f68052f73))
- **Modern JavaScript runtime optimization** using static `Object.hasOwn` instead of dynamic property checks for better performance ([1bc3ab8](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1bc3ab8cde58915a35b4f2af59fae9c27f8dc392))
- **Improved weak reference handling** with complete runtime reimplementation for better memory management ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Global dead code elimination regression tests** added to prevent future issues ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067), [ebc6c4c](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/ebc6c4c00ccfede2fff6890e2f9c81b8b91bf5a8))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Major architectural shift with extensive code removal and new feature request for Dom_html modernization
oldest_week.activity:
- **Complete architectural transformation** removing all WebAssembly compilation support in favor of pure JavaScript target, affecting compiler, runtime, and build systems ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Documentation rewrite** completely updating README from wasm_of_ocaml focus to comprehensive js_of_ocaml documentation with installation guides, feature descriptions, and data representation details ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Runtime system modernization** across multiple JavaScript modules including improvements to weak references, bigarray handling, and parsing functions ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Build system cleanup** removing wasm-related build configurations, test suites, and GitHub workflow files while updating opam package specifications ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Major simplification trend moving from dual JS/WASM targets to single JavaScript focus
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Backend consolidation strategy** with the project moving away from dual compilation targets (JavaScript + WebAssembly) to focus exclusively on JavaScript compilation, simplifying maintenance and development efforts
- **Modern JavaScript adoption** with runtime optimizations using current browser APIs like `Object.hasOwn` for improved performance and compatibility
- **Enhanced debugging capabilities** through improved sourcemap handling, particularly for complex linking scenarios involving multiple JavaScript files
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Limited activity with one feature request by Jérôme Vouillon and ongoing experimental work by hhugo
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) opened feature request [#1719](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1719) for auditing and modernizing Dom_html module, focusing on updating mouse event properties from int to float and removing outdated Internet Explorer compatibility code
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) continues experimental work on monomorphic representation for MlBytes in [#1229](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1229), an ongoing draft PR from 2022 focused on runtime performance optimizations using deoptigate analysis

latest_week.brief_summary: Untagged int arrays landed alongside compiler optimization fixes and type system refinements
latest_week.new_features_summary: Untagged int8/int16/int arrays, f64/i64 cast builtins, register affinity, and several compiler optimization fixes
latest_week.new_features:
- **Untagged integer array support** added for `int8#`, `int16#`, and `int#` arrays with packed storage and new stdlib functions `Sys.max_untagged_int8_array_length`, `Sys.max_untagged_int16_array_length`, and `Sys.max_untagged_int_array_length` ([#4643](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4643))
- **Float64/Int64 cast builtins** marked as `[@@builtin]` in `Int64.of_float` and `Int64.to_float` enabling direct static casts without runtime overhead ([#5114](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5114))
- **Register allocation affinity** added to all three allocators (IRC, linscan, greedy) to prefer physical registers with high move affinity between temporaries ([#5059](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5059))
- **CFG peephole optimization** that eliminates integer operations when the immediate operand is a neutral element like adding zero or multiplying by one ([#4932](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4932))
- Fixed illegal expression re-orderings in `to_cmm` that could cause segfaults by introducing validity tracking for safe transformations ([#4941](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4941))
- Fixed code size computation bugs in switch optimizations for `Boolean_not` switches ([#5121](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5121)) and lookup table conversions ([#5120](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5120))
- Fixed primitive removal accounting to properly handle canonicalized arguments during inlining decisions ([#5118](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5118))
- Added profiling counters to track speculative inlining that doesn't decrease code size for debugging optimization issues ([#5116](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5116))
- Improved modal inclusion error messages for better type system diagnostics ([#5112](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5112))
- **Documentation updates** for small numbers extension describing packed storage for `int8# array` and `int16# array` with representation details ([f042d631c^..71aae05ca](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/compare/f042d631c^..71aae05ca))
latest_week.activity_summary: Type system work focused on abstract kinds, modes, and layouts alongside ongoing debug info and name mangling improvements
latest_week.activity:
- **New PRs opened** include reversible name mangling by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) enabling full module path reconstruction ([#5099](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5099)), match-in-match fix for over-applications by [Guillaume Bury](https://github.com/gbury) ([#5119](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5119)), functor non-legacy mode support by [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) ([#5107](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5107)), debug info performance improvements by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#5124](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5124)), and IRC affinity tweaks by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#5113](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5113))
- **Type system refactoring** merged abstract kinds part 1 by [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) eliminating cyclic dependencies to enable abstract kinds ([#5070](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5070)), with part 2 adding basic abstract kinds and kind aliases now under review ([#5071](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5071))
- **Layout and axis work** includes [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) merging nullability as scannable axis ([#5086](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5086)), adding `non_pointer64` to separability axis ([#5095](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5095)), and opening PR to use scannable axes in Lambda translation for avoiding unnecessary `caml_modify` calls ([#5104](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5104))
- **Debug information infrastructure** progressing with [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) opening PRs for gathering debug info ([#5096](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5096)), improved debug tracking ([#5098](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5098)), and name mangling configuration ([#5097](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5097)), while [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) works on named binders for shapes ([#5111](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5111)) and shape default flipping ([#5103](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5103))
- **Ongoing work** includes preemption by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([#4881](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4881)), translquote review by [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr) ([#4981](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4981)), untagged int indexing primitives by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) ([#4779](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4779)), repr_ syntax additions by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) ([#5068](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5068)), and spawnable mode by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) ([#5110](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5110))
- **Quote-related fixes** progressing with [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian) addressing annotation drops on `let rec` ([#5083](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5083)), elaboration of compound terms ([#5090](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5090)), and record/variant disambiguation ([#5094](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5094))
- **Infrastructure improvements** merged musl variant for GitHub CI by [Kevin Svetlitski](https://github.com/Svetlitski) ([#5123](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5123)) and Reaper debugging flag by [Nathanaëlle Courant](https://github.com/Ekdohibs) ([#5106](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5106))
latest_week.trends_summary: Compiler optimization correctness, type system axis infrastructure, and developer tooling improvements
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Compiler optimization correctness** focus with multiple PRs fixing code size computation bugs ([#5120](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5120), [#5121](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5121), [#5118](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5118)) and illegal transformations ([#4941](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4941)), accompanied by new issue calling for terminology review ([#5122](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5122))
- **Scannable axes migration** continuing with nullability ([#5086](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5086)) and separability ([#5095](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5095)) now using axis machinery, enabling optimizations like avoiding `caml_modify` ([#5104](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5104))
- **Developer experience improvements** with name mangling enabling better debugger integration ([#5099](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5099)), debug info performance work ([#5124](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5124)), and tutorial fixes ([#5109](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5109)) addressing user-reported issues ([#5105](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5105))
- **Register allocation refinement** with affinity support merged ([#5059](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5059)) and IRC tweaks under review ([#5113](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5113)), while new issue identifies split behavior problems ([#5115](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5115))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Repository restructuring with backend directory moved to asmcomp, plus runtime and flambda improvements
