oldest_week.activity_summary: Major repository restructuring completed with backend directory moved to asmcomp, plus runtime issues addressed
oldest_week.activity:
- **Repository restructuring** completed by moving entire `backend/` directory structure to `asmcomp/` location, affecting hundreds of files including compiler internals, architecture-specific code, and debugging infrastructure
- **Runtime compatibility** addressed with [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) reporting OCAMLRUNPARAM=v=4096 flag overloading issue where custom timestamp behavior conflicts with upstream OCaml 5.1 changes ([#3158](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3158))
- **Flambda2 development** progressed with [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) closing continuation lifting issue after implementation completion ([#2413](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/2413))
- **Compiler optimizations** delivered through multiple PRs including string scope refactoring ([#3117](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3117)), directory flag refactoring ([#3120](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3120)), and debuginfo comparison improvements ([#3119](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3119))
- **Type system enhancements** completed with layouts documentation for contravariance ([#3144](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3144)) and unboxed vector types mode crossing fixes ([#3138](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3138))
- **Performance improvements** achieved through array reference kind refactoring ([#3152](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3152)) and block header field reordering reversion ([#3145](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3145))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on compiler infrastructure reorganization and runtime system improvements
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Compiler architecture consolidation** with major directory restructuring moving backend functionality into asmcomp for better organization
- **Runtime system refinement** addressing compatibility issues between custom extensions and upstream OCaml changes
- **Flambda2 optimization maturity** with continuation lifting and other advanced compiler optimizations reaching completion
- **Type system evolution** continuing work on layouts, modes, and unboxed types for performance improvements
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Two contributors active with issue reporting and closure
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) reported runtime parameter compatibility issue with OCAMLRUNPARAM=v=4096 flag behavior conflicting with upstream OCaml 5.1 changes ([#3158](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3158))
- [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) closed the continuation lifting issue after successful implementation in Flambda2 optimization pipeline ([#2413](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/2413))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Enhanced locate command with context overrides and merged major OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 changes plus tooling improvements
oldest_week.new_features_summary: New `-context` flag for locate command enables precise namespace searching and automated magic number update script
oldest_week.new_features:
- Enhanced **locate command** with new `-context` flag allowing explicit namespace specification via values like `expr`, `module_path`, `type`, `constructor`, `label`, etc., overriding context inference ([#91](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/91))
- New **magic numbers update script** (`update-magic-numbers.sh`) for automated OCaml version compatibility maintenance, automatically syncing magic numbers from upstream OCaml flambda configuration ([#108](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/108))
- Fixed **EXCLUDE_QUERY_DIR directive** handling for cmt/cms files, ensuring proper directory exclusion behavior during indexing ([#104](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/104))
- Improved **ghost location handling** in occurrences query by switching from ghost location filtering to `Location.none` filtering, better supporting let punning and PPX-generated code ([#110](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/110))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Multiple infrastructure improvements including OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 merge and cleanup of unused magic numbers
oldest_week.activity:
- **Locate command enhancement** completed by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) adding flexible context override capability for precise namespace searches, enabling users to specify exact identifier search contexts rather than relying on position inference ([#91](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/91))
- **OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 integration** delivered through comprehensive upstream merge by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), bringing latest flambda backend changes while temporarily deferring parameterized module support ([#106](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/106))
- **Development tooling improved** with new automated magic numbers update script by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), streamlining OCaml version compatibility maintenance with validation and error checking ([#108](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/108))
- **Code cleanup completed** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) removing unused magic numbers from configuration, reducing maintenance overhead and potential confusion ([#107](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/107))
- **Bug fix implemented** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) for EXCLUDE_QUERY_DIR directive handling in cmt/cms files, with intention to upstream the fix to main OCaml merlin ([#104](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/104))
- **Occurrences query improvement** merged by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) switching from ghost location to `Location.none` filtering, coordinated with related [ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend#3137](https://github.com/ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend/issues/3137) changes ([#110](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/110))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on OCaml compatibility and development workflow improvements with coordination across repositories
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-repository coordination** evident through synchronization between merlin and [ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend](https://github.com/ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend) projects, particularly for occurrences filtering changes and upstream integration planning
- **Development automation** emphasis with creation of tooling for automated magic numbers maintenance, reducing manual overhead for OCaml version updates
- **User experience improvements** through enhanced locate command functionality providing more precise control over identifier resolution in complex codebases
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Primary development by Liam Stevenson with review participation from Nick Roberts and Richard Eisenberg
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) implemented all merged features including locate command enhancement ([#91](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/91)), OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 integration ([#106](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/106)), automated magic numbers script ([#108](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/108)), code cleanup ([#107](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/107)), bug fix ([#104](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/104)), and occurrences improvement ([#110](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/110))
- [Nick Roberts](https://github.com/ncik-roberts) provided code review feedback and suggestions for magic numbers handling improvements ([#107](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/107), [#108](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/108))
- [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) participated in review discussions for occurrences query changes, coordinating with flambda-backend dependencies ([#110](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/110))

latest_week.brief_summary: Two PRs opened addressing package versioning flexibility and js_of_ocaml build compatibility
latest_week.activity_summary: Package dependency management improvements and js_of_ocaml build fix proposals
latest_week.activity:
- **Package versioning flexibility** proposal by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) introducing automated guard packages to allow multiple versions of upstream patched packages ([#27](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/27)), with discussion on approach soundness and potential Zarith 1.14 compatibility concerns
- **js_of_ocaml toplevel build fix** by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) removing problematic `[%%if]` patch that causes extension errors ([#26](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/26))
- **Upstream package updates** from [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) adding ocamlbuild, async_ssl, alcotest, sedlex, topkg, and uutf updates to enable more upstream packages ([#23](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/23)), with ongoing investigation of install scenarios
latest_week.discussions_summary: Technical discussion on automated patch guard package generation and Zarith compatibility
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **Patch guard package approach** discussed between [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) and [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) in [#27](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/27), with focus on automated generation of `oxcaml-` guard packages to manage patched package versions and potential Zarith 1.14 issues requiring investigation at [avsm/Zarith#1](https://github.com/avsm/Zarith/pull/1)
- **Install scenario validation** requested by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) in [#23](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/23) to demonstrate packages that currently fail but would work with proposed updates
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on package dependency flexibility and build compatibility for OxCaml ecosystem
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Automated dependency management** emerging as priority with shift from manual conflicts clauses to generated guard packages enabling multiple patched package versions ([#27](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/27))
- **Build compatibility maintenance** across js_of_ocaml and upstream packages requiring ongoing patch adjustments ([#26](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/26), [#23](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/23))
latest_week.contributors_summary: Three contributors opened PRs addressing package management and build compatibility
latest_week.contributors:
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) proposed automated guard package system for flexible patched package versioning ([#27](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/27)), participated in discussions on Zarith compatibility, and requested install scenario examples for upstream updates ([#23](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/23))
- [Anil Madhavapeddy](https://github.com/avsm) opened PR for upstream package updates to enable broader compatibility ([#23](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/23)) and provided feedback on guard package approach ([#27](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/27))
- [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) opened PR to fix js_of_ocaml-toplevel build failure by removing problematic extension patch ([#26](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository/pull/26))

latest_week.contributors_summary: Vesa Karvonen opened draft PR for mpmcq API extension
latest_week.contributors: - [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) opened draft PR to add `peek_exn` operation to the multi-producer multi-consumer queue implementation ([#378](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/pull/378))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Ten PRs merged focusing on performance optimizations and hash table enhancements
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Hash table gained consensus protocol operations and improved Trigger documentation
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Hash table consensus operations** added comprehensive set of atomic operations including `try_set`, `try_compare_and_set`, `set_exn`, `try_compare_and_remove` designed for building consensus protocols over arbitrary numbers of processes ([#317](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/317))
- **Trigger documentation improvements** with enhanced explanations of scheduler interface and added usage notes for `Trigger.from_action` ([#318](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/318))
- **Documentation navigation** improvements by moving libraries section to top of index page for quicker access ([#313](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/313))
- **Development tooling** enhancement ensuring `sherlodoc` installation for proper documentation search functionality ([#315](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/315))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Single contributor focused on performance optimizations and platform consistency improvements
oldest_week.activity:
- **Performance optimization series** delivered through multiple PRs by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) including fast path tweaks for computation waiting/peeking ([#310](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/310)), stack usage reduction ([#311](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/311), [#312](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/312)), and inlining improvements ([#309](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/309))
- **External dependency integration** with removal of internal `Countdown` implementation in favor of using version from `multicore-bench` library ([#316](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/316))
- **Experimental performance work** exploring CPU relaxation during yielding to reduce contention, though this approach was closed without merging after showing no measurable effect ([#303](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/303))
oldest_week.discussions_summary: Documentation feedback discussion on Trigger module clarity and English usage
oldest_week.notable_discussions: - **Documentation feedback exchange** between [Carine Morel](https://github.com/lyrm) and [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) covering Trigger module documentation clarity, particularly around grammatical usage of "and" vs "or" connectors, alert handler formatting, and explanation of engineering terminology like "problem domain" ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/39))
oldest_week.issues_summary: Documentation feedback issue available for community contributions
oldest_week.good_first_issues: - **Documentation improvements** sought for better clarity in module explanations, with specific feedback welcomed on areas that may be unclear to users less familiar with the codebase ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/39))
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Primary development by Vesa Karvonen with documentation feedback from Carine Morel
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) implemented all code changes including hash table enhancements ([#317](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/317)), performance optimizations across multiple PRs ([#309](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/309), [#310](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/310), [#311](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/311), [#312](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/312)), documentation improvements ([#313](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/313), [#315](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/315), [#318](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/318)), and external library integration ([#316](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/316))
- [Carine Morel](https://github.com/lyrm) provided detailed documentation feedback on Trigger module clarity and readability, contributing to improved user experience ([#39](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/39))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Fork action header exposed for external libraries and Windows symlink test improvements merged
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Made fork_action.h public header for external libraries and improved Windows symlink test compatibility
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Public header exposure** for `fork_action.h` enabling external libraries to provide new fork actions by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) ([#769](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/769))
- **Windows symlink test compatibility** check using `Unix.has_symlink()` to skip symlink tests on systems without support by [Onah_Anthony](https://github.com/create2000) ([#771](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/771))
oldest_week.activity_summary: New PRs opened for Process.pipe type relaxation and Windows test improvements, ongoing Windows compatibility work
oldest_week.activity:
- **New PRs opened** include Process.pipe type relaxation by [Isaac Arogbonlo](https://github.com/Arogbonlo) ([#767](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/767), [#770](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/770)) and Windows symlink test improvements by [Onah_Anthony](https://github.com/create2000) ([#766](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/766), [#768](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/768))
- **Windows compatibility** work continues with native implementation attempts by [Kento Okura](https://github.com/kentookura) ([#738](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/738)) and test suite enablement efforts ([#761](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/761))
- **Type system improvements** discussed around `Eio.Process.pipe` return types for better API compatibility with monomorphic types ([#750](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/750))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on Windows compatibility and type system flexibility for better external library integration
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Windows platform support** receiving increased attention with multiple contributors working on test compatibility ([#761](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/761), [#766](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/766), [#768](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/768), [#771](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/771), [#738](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/738))
- **External library integration** improvements with public header exposure for fork actions ([#769](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/769))
- **Type system flexibility** work to improve API compatibility between Eio and external libraries like Cohttp ([#750](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/750), [#767](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/767), [#770](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/770))
oldest_week.issues_summary: Three good first issues available covering Windows testing, chmod implementation, and Process.pipe type improvements
oldest_week.good_first_issues:
- **Windows test suite enablement** ([#761](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/761)) by [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) with guidance on incrementally enabling MDX tests on Windows platform
- **Chmod support implementation** ([#764](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/764)) by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) with existing foundation work available and interest from [@webbunivAdmin](https://github.com/webbunivAdmin)
- **Process.pipe return type relaxation** ([#750](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/750)) by [Rizo](https://github.com/rizo) to improve compatibility with monomorphic API types, with ongoing implementation work by [Isaac Arogbonlo](https://github.com/Arogbonlo)
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Patrick Ferris led development with merged PRs, Onah_Anthony contributed Windows test fixes, Isaac Arogbonlo worked on type system improvements
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) merged fork action header exposure ([#769](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/769)) and provided extensive code review guidance across multiple PRs including Process.pipe work ([#767](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/767), [#770](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/770)) and Windows compatibility efforts ([#766](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/766), [#768](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/768))
- [Onah_Anthony](https://github.com/create2000) successfully merged Windows symlink test improvements ([#771](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/771)) after iterative refinement and opened multiple related PRs ([#766](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/766), [#768](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/768))
- [Isaac Arogbonlo](https://github.com/Arogbonlo) opened two PRs working on Process.pipe type relaxation ([#767](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/767), [#770](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/770)) and engaged in detailed technical discussions about type system improvements
- [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) provided technical guidance on type casting approaches and Process.pipe implementation details ([#770](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/770)) and approved the fork action header change ([#769](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/769))
- [Richard Chukwu](https://github.com/RichardChukwu) reported testing findings for Windows compatibility work ([#761](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/761)) and [@oyenuga17](https://github.com/oyenuga17) provided coordination support
- [Daniel Marvin](https://github.com/webbunivAdmin) expressed interest in contributing to chmod implementation ([#764](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/764))
